COURSE¶

class task_course.Task_Course(run: task_share.Share, Omega_L: task_share.Share, Omega_R: task_share.Share, heading: task_share.Share, yaw_rate: task_share.Share, centroid: task_share.Share, bump: task_share.Share, enc_reset_L: task_share.Share, enc_reset_R: task_share.Share, theta_L: task_share.Share, theta_R: task_share.Share)¶

The Task_Course task guides ROMI through a predefined course using a list of Path objects. Each path segment specifies the desired velocity, heading, yaw rate, and whether ROMI should follow a line or a compass heading. It uses PID controllers to adjust ROMI’s movement.

Parameters:

  • run – A share that signals the task to start running the course.

  • Omega_L – A share of angular velocity of the left wheel in rad/s.

  • Omega_R – A share of angular velocity of the right wheel in rad/s.

  • heading – A share of the current heading angle of the robot in degrees.

  • yaw_rate – A share of the measured yaw rate of the robot in rad/s.

  • centroid – A share of the detected position of the line.

  • bump – A share of indicating whether a collision been detected.

  • enc_reset_L – A share to reset the left encoder count.

  • enc_reset_R – A share to reset the right encoder count.

  • theta_L – A share of the cumulative angle measured by the left wheel encoder.

  • theta_R – A share of the cumulative angle measured by the right wheel encoder.

task()¶

Generator Function to run implemented Finite-State Machine

MECHA03 ROMI
